organization.fullName: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Regular Brisk Walking in Chronic Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Regular Brisk Walking in Chronic Stroke Patients

leadSponsor.name: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Chronic stroke patients (\>6 months) fulfilling including criteria were trained during 3 months. The physical training program was based on walking.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Participants had been evaluated 4 times during a long follow-up period of 7 months. Activity limitations were assessed at baseline (enrollment time point), 1 month, 4 months and 7 months later.

armGroups.label: walking
armGroups.description: a cohort of stroke patients trained during 3 month, based on walking

secondaryOutcomes.description: Stroke related impairment are assessed with specific outcomes measures (SIAS, BBS, ...).
Walking ability is assessed throuht walking speed and walking endurance

references.citation: Batcho CS, Stoquart G, Thonnard JL. Brisk walking can promote functional recovery in chronic stroke patients. J Rehabil Med. 2013 Sep;45(9):854-9. doi: 10.2340/16501977-1211.
